command.name: awk
command.description: Find and Replace text within file(s)

option.name: F
option.description: Define the input field separator = regular expression fs.

option.name: v
option.description: var=value Assign values before prog is executed, any number of -v options may be present.

option.name: f
option.description: Set the maximum size of the input record (MaxRows)

option.name: mr
option.description: progfile Specify a pattern to match within progfile rather then on the command line.

option.name: mf
option.description: Set the maximum number of fields (MaxFields)

command.name: basename
command.description: Convert a full pathname to just a filename

command.name: bind
command.description: Display readline key and function bindings

command.name: bless
command.description: Set volume bootability and startup disk options.

command.name: caller
command.description: Return the context of a subroutine call

command.name: cat
command.description: Concatenate and print (display) the contents of file(s)

command.name: chflags
command.description: Change a file or folders flags

command.name: chroot
command.description: Run a command with a different root directory

command.name: cksum
command.description: Print CRC checksum and byte counts

command.name: comm
command.description: Compare two sorted files line by line

command.name: continue
command.description: Resume the next iteration of a loop

command.name: cp
command.description: Copy one or more files to another location

command.name: crontab
command.description: Schedule a command to run at a later date/time

command.name: curl
command.description: Transfer data from or to a server

command.name: cut
command.description: Divide a file into several parts

command.name: date
command.description: Display or change the date & time

command.name: dd
command.description: Data Dump - Convert and copy a file

command.name: diff
command.description: Display the differences between two files

command.name: dirname
command.description: Convert a full pathname to just a path

command.name: disown
command.description: Unbind a job from the current login session

command.name: enable
command.description: Enable and disable builtin shell commands

command.name: fdisk
command.description: Partition table manipulator for Darwin UFS/HFS/DOS

command.name: find
command.description: Search for files that meet a desired criteria

command.name: fold
command.description: Wrap text to fit a specified width

command.name: goto
command.description: Jump to label and continue execution

command.name: grep
command.description: Search file(s) for lines that match a given pattern

command.name: groups
command.description: Print group names a user is in

command.name: halt
command.description: Stop and restart the operating system

command.name: hash
command.description: Refresh the cached/remembered location of commands

command.name: head
command.description: Display the first lines of a file

command.name: iconv
command.description: Convert the character set of a file

command.name: join
command.description: Join lines on a common field

command.name: last
command.description: Indicate last logins of users and ttys

command.name: less
command.description: Display output one screen at a time

command.name: ln
command.description: Make links between files (hard links, symbolic links)

command.name: lprm
command.description: Remove jobs from the print queue

command.name: lsbom
command.description: List a bill of materials file

command.name: more
command.description: Display output one screen at a time

command.name: mv
command.description: Move or rename files or directories

command.name: nice
command.description: Set the priority of a command

command.name: nohup
command.description: Run a command immune to hangups

command.name: onintr
command.description: Control the action of a shell interrupt

command.name: opensnoop
command.description: Snoop file opens as they occur

command.name: popd
command.description: Restore the previous value of the current directory

command.name: pushd
command.description: Save and then change the current directory

command.name: read
command.description: Read one line from standard input

command.name: readonly
command.description: Mark a variable or function as read-only

command.name: rsync
command.description: Remote file copy - Sync file tree (also RsyncX)

command.name: screen
command.description: Multiplex terminal, run remote shells via ssh

command.name: split
command.description: Split a file into fixed-size pieces

command.name: sudo
command.description: Execute a command as another user

command.name: sum
command.description: Print a checksum for a file

command.name: sw_vers
command.description: Print Mac OS X operating system version

command.name: tail
command.description: Output the last part of files

command.name: textutil
command.description: Manipulate text files in various formats (Doc,html,rtf)

command.name: trap
command.description: Execute a command when the shell receives a signal

command.name: tty
command.description: Print filename of terminal on stdin

command.name: ulimit
command.description: limit the use of system-wide resources

command.name: units
command.description: Convert units from one scale to another

command.name: uptime
command.description: Show how long system has been running

command.name: users
command.description: Print login names of users currently logged in

command.name: uudecode
command.description: Decode a file created by uuencode

command.name: wait
command.description: Wait for a process to complete

command.name: wc
command.description: Print byte, word, and line counts

command.name: whatis
command.description: Search the whatis database for complete words

command.name: where
command.description: Report all known instances of a command

command.name: which
command.description: Locate a program file in the user's path

command.name: who
command.description: Print all usernames currently logged on

command.name: whoami
command.description: Print the current user id and name (`id -un')

command.name: write
command.description: Send a message to another user
